predicate.note: Frames file for 'chisel' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 26.1.

roleset.name: use a chisel to build something

example.name: weird example
example.text: Looking leaner than he has in a while, the younger Mr. Bridges's Jack is sexy and cynical and a far sadder case than Frank, who [*T*-1]'s managed [*-20] to chisel his dreams [*-2] to fit reality without feeling too cheated.
example.note: I'm taking the 'fitting reality' as an end state of the dreams. Like I said, a weird example.

example.name: more clearly building
example.text: John chiseled a perfect portrait of Mary out of a block of ice.
